Donald Rumsfeld , who served as President Bush 's defense chief for six years after holding the the same job under president Gerald Ford in the 1970s, acknowledged that in a war, many things cost lives. But he had no regrets about his leadership of the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan-- the latter now nearing its 10th anniversary. He refused to echo the regrets of another domineering defense secretary--
